title: Area Three: Communication, Literacy, and Language Development
subject: Early Learning and Development Standards (2021-)

document.title: VIRGINIA’S EARLY LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT STANDARDS (ELDS): BIRTH-FIVE LEARNING GUIDELINES

7C90608C2B174790A652FC41FA88038A.description:
Uses a variety of digital
tools to write or draw

0F0ADDC3972E4DEC9A2B20747791CE3B.description:
Begins to use a
comfortable and
efficient three-finger
grip to control a
variety of writing tools

0F271B3C06954E8D9B6DC00E1B4122E6.description:
Becomes more skillful
with a variety of writing
tools (e.g., markers, pens,
pencils, crayons, chalk)

87D1C29A98C34BFE86BF3D1294DF2CEF.description:
Begins to show
increased fine motor
strength in writing

207B99C000F84C06A56D9F6B863494D4.description:
Attempts to use their
fingertips to grip writing
tools, finger grip may
be loose or too tight and
finger positioning may
be too high or too close
to the tip

CCD51DE7CB3D477FB237545DB697B960.description:
Uses the whole arm
to control and direct the
scribbles, marks, drawing,
and writing intentions

F09D09CDFF144E88A2A4D37FCE18360D.description:
Begins to use a whole
hand grip to manipulate
the writing tool

2A4D0958C29940A5885794BAF418CFBC.description:
Begins to grasp writing
tools to make random
marks on a paper with
limited control over
results

10F525FC41FC478DBB46271C3C5F04EC.description:
Begins to make a plan
for the writing they will
produce (e.g., creates
picture to tell story and
then writes)

C897573B80D34EA7B52FBD55D04AFE2F.description:
Begins to revise
by adding details to
drawings/writings
to express their ideas

C4A2D007A4A14AF290AB7B48447E13CF.description:
Continues to revise
writing in the moment
based on interactions
with peers and adults

CC49368E55D14E619A80F6842E47B7BD.description: Begins to modify and expand their drawings/ writing to meet personal ideas and include others’ ideas (e.g., several children begin drawing rainbows and unicorns after one child narrates their work)

0C4722162CF84CD5BCBB1B6FCC633A76.description:
Begins to revise
writing in the moment
based on interactions
with peers and adults

C70FE1E28F794BDE805F3EF12AD4A5F3.description:
Shares writing
with others as a way
to represent their
understandings and ideas

9E32B853B4064A66B93C0887581387F1.description:
Begins to share
drawings/writing and
explains the meaning
of the illustrations/text
(e.g., says circle is a ball)

4BE8B1C29C59475C8D88CD33AB534543.description:
Shows interest in
exploring writing by
watching others write
and experimenting with
writing tools (e.g., tries
using crayons, markers,
etc. to make marks)

D7179940AD3B4C048B97B77ED5B175AB.description:
Begins to copy names
of familiar people and
objects

E6BFE9C1060D468AB148E8217F20E58A.description:
Begins to produce a
correct representation of
their name using capital
letters, lowercase letters,
or a combination of both
moving from left to right

D5064E403841432A84E3D073413B35D7.description:
Represents all letters
in their own name, with
sequencing, positioning,
and reversals still
evidenced

CEE5A092CAD84A959BCB0CC9D04F9DFD.description:
Retells or reads
their writing to others

4AB5D64B22DA4A348B7CE79C2D59699F.description:
Begins to represent the
initial and final sounds
to represent a word (e.g.,
‘dg’ for dog)

E0BD81786DAE4DB9814F4AC84409D0C5.description:
Begins to use initial
letter sounds to represent
a whole word (e.g., /f/ for
fish)

750A7DA252564588AE959EF750F50521.description:
Begins to distinguish
print from images or
illustrations

2884D8B4FDF5483E903C1EBDE4B73E97.description:
Begins to recognize
name as separate from
other pictures or writing
produced

DBAC2263171A46BCA2DF8DFC13B93596.description:
Begins to represent
all letters in their name

E604B966A2C74AEF998AE9B954BF0333.description:
Begins to copy or
write letters or numbers

9D24CBD72563447F8E27680D2B634865.description:
Begins to use print
in the environment as
part of their writing
(e.g., attempts to copy a
sign or poster in room)

30504611D28D494B98FE7B6D1794FF4E.description:
Begins to use letter
strings or a group of
letters to represent words,
ideas, phrases, sentences,
and stories or events

A86F034483364AA0BD6C0E928671AEF8.description:
Begins to draw/
write for a variety of
purposes (e.g., grocery
lists, invitations, birthday
cards)

72F1DBA165CB4A508CD6F53650C4A58B.description:
Begins to draw/write
for a variety of audiences
(e.g., family members
and teachers)

0F5A539824CB4F9B80ED37959D6FB146.description:
Begins to use distinct
letter-like symbols and
letter formations with
curves, lines, circles, and
dots to represent words,
ideas, phrases, sentences,
and stories or events
with or without drawing

AE1C2521497343009DAA0B74B3702A6D.description:
Attempts to “read”
their writing or drawing
to others, including their
name

A7E0E34E4A1A46FC9757ACD2D9DFEC04.description:
Begins to use scribbles
or intentional marks
to represent objects

F2BD0D81CBFC4D3B9B409CBBE310D676.description:
Writes in a linear
fashion and connects
marks with repetitive up/
down or looping motions

41661374FAFA4CA7B221429DA6D1CB30.description:
Begins to use
controlled marks like
swoops, circles, and
waves to represent their
ideas

38E8DEB1912446CEA4DC680DA8AFAEE3.description:
Uses writing
instruments to
make distinct marks

CF9BACE955BE401E8D4EE95C2D3EB53E.description:
Understands that
marks on a page can
communicate meaning

84F34451AE0C4C198BC9712CE4DCE1B4.description:
Makes scribbles
or marks on writing
materials

B483FF43A1864CE28B34F7793F277646.description: Drawing, scribbling, and writing to communicate

9225228C7FF744A9A94DD373DE00C0A5.description:
Will use a combination
of letters and symbols
to represent words

D15AF0180F0A4BFD9D4F35374BF5C7DB.description:
Recognizes many
upper and lower case
letters

1982F36042334D348814496A767F28F7.description:
For many, with
instructional support,
matches the letter with
the corresponding sound

E431A6A28FE9464391D1487B3FAE65BE.description: For many, with instructional support, matches the sound with the corresponding letter

2AA1602378FD4AEC809EB38210A0D657.description:
Can often write first
name from memory

EFA7E09A53D44F5F8E84EB6D7FAB33D8.description:
Begins to connect
alphabet letters and
corresponding sounds
(e.g., connecting
letters and sounds of
common letters/words)

D543BCA956AF46EFBB9C5F3356852358.description:
Identifies sounds
and recognizes letters
associated with
beginning of first
name and last name

E9C90706D0A04B89B6A586A7BB46F9B2.description:
Begins to recognize
more upper, and lower
case letters if taught

114DB6BC0966411094A92BB2F2229972.description:
Begins to recognize
a few upper or lower
case letters (if taught)

AD66703B5C894B69910375409CD717DF.description: Learning how letters and print work to create words and meaning

8D4F4B67D1B247D3ACB41B33852DD6AB.description:
Begins to identify the
initial and final sound in
words (e.g., /b/ in bat)

37A87EF6B02646A5B72C961929BA424E.description:
Begins to segment and
combine syllables (e.g.,
purple segmented is purple; when combined it is
purple)

4E173D2E5F92430E871341B08B825B93.description:
Begins to orally
segment and combine
compound words (e.g.,
lunchbox segmented
is lunch-box; when
combined it is lunchbox)

581CB6E09F924A80B8965DFDF2AAF551.description:
Begins to rhyme and
produce rhymes of simple
words

1033496387D94F83B5941735CEA51008.description:
With instructional
support, distinguishes
when two words rhyme
and when two words
begin with the same
sound (e.g., boy/toy,
dog/dad)

7223BC99D3354B80A976334DD00EEA0D.description:
Imitates and enjoys
rhyme and alliteration
(e.g., Jalisa jumped)

87F4CC7BC7A74854A5D96FEA06819E53.description:
Imitates most sounds of
language using familiar
words

D14BEC73C0C14D0F9C201924158D07DA.description:
Orally produces
or reproduces simple
culturally and
linguistically familiar
rhymes or sings favorite
songs

5D1423CABDB04F8C9CAFDDBC48F0BD17.description:
Orally repeats a few
words of culturally and
linguistically familiar
rhymes and repetitive
refrains in stories or songs
or directions/ requests
from adults or peers

C7F773D33D364657B69D3214F57F063E.description:
Begins to imitate
sounds they hear in their
everyday environment

D1A2E72CD8C64D0FA106F0FD5F3A4C6A.description:
Begins to create speech
and non-speech like
sounds (e.g., babbling)

B54EB552660E4C72A2D82A6096F46D85.description:
Listens and attends
to culturally and
linguistically familiar
words or signs (including
rhymes and songs)

5FAA5D0FD36F4E08B5D70BB654147C7F.description: Learning spoken language is composed of smaller segments of sound

7CAB273CB37C4F36B3C43C5F326A5263.description:
Uses new words
learned through listening
to stories

B07CA27E404A4FAAB62D13DDE4572E2B.description:
Predicts what
will happen next in
an unfamiliar story

7F774973C0F8433988B17FAD70B93DA6.description:
Begins to understand
cause and effect
relationships in fiction
and nonfiction texts

2AD33A55C7C54F719CD17271DBB1A15A.description:
Tells fictional
or personal stories
sequentially and with
3 or more details

113B362F18374AB6BCE45285F38402B7.description:
Listens and responds
to a variety of texts and
media (e.g., audio book,
music and movement)

23E0013B6A914392B6E527EB35742975.description:
Recognizes nouns
as the person, place,
or thing in a sentence

B892D00EBF124491AAF438DF7B2A7573.description:
Recites from memory
words, phrases, and
parts of favorite stories

6DAB52EF5A0F485F9C6EEAD606F53599.description:
Narrates a story using
pictures as a guide

DF2A09BE1E824879BE783AE447AB8DB7.description:
Retells 1-2 key events
from a story

25EDD9E258244F9FB33FFE91BAA56F5B.description:
Asks or answers
questions about what is
happening in a book or
story

A12636D23AB94750AAAC84E59C683A5A.description:
Repeats words heard
during story reading

E0F442C922F541398305122AA058BF5C.description:
Expresses empathy for
characters and problems
in text and stories with
adult guidance and
support

5C020F376F4C4942874BCECEF6B3575F.description:
Makes connections to
the story through talking
about characters and
events

10CE395246DE4D0DAA2C9945B1AE4B12.description:
Asks to be read to
or asks the meaning of
written text

7661EDA1750B42A3ADC1B35CA0D98A81.description:
Identifies the feelings
of characters in a book or
story

082336ACE52846C895E41310F9316F71.description:
Listens to explanations
of words or repeats
words adults explain or
emphasize

02A22C941756493FAE745541295CF744.description:
Engages in familiar
stories verbally (e.g.,
fills in a word when the
reader pauses) or with
motions (e.g., imitates
actions with an adult)

391F883993D94FE3BA13914F166F22BF.description:
Begins to show specific
interest in being read to
(e.g., brings a book to an
adult or points to pictures
in the environment or a
book)

556D150D86D448209FE2A34AD1472768.description:
Touches or points
to pictures in response
to adult’s prompt

B913C181F5E041AA92B080C194D084CA.description:
Looks at picture books
and listens to an adult talk
about pictures in a book

B46FCF4E6A304B629374166F456D8196.description: Understanding ideas, vocabulary, and information in stories and texts

3E52CD4295CE4BA8BCB10AD4C7479210.description:
Begins to track
individual words in text
or braille by pointing or
touching

6BAB602C67294E2383C40BD7548FBBD3.description:
Distinguishes among a
variety of texts and their
purposes (e.g., books,
shopping lists, etc.)

69C8078F33734F88BE59A1C0A74DEF8C.description:
Understands that the
print communicates the
message in stories or
other texts

799FBA3354FA4705B8C9391F0028E791.description:
Demonstrates an
understanding of the
conventions of print
(e.g., directionality
of print and texts)

0D0E5BCB45164CBD935DFDBA94DB16CD.description:
Begins to select books
for reading enjoyment
and reading related
activities, including
pretending to read to self
or others

B8F8B0461BAA4EE7AEF00B3E62F2951D.description:
Points to and names
some letters or characters
in their names when
seen in other words

B6AF86BD86E840BDBE2FBF9DF7365F73.description:
Identifies common
words in the
environment (e.g., name,
exit, stop)

BD75AF9BDABE428E87D5E3CF86E34A28.description:
Attributes meaning to
some symbols, such as a
familiar logo or design

6E3D89FF798D4DE4B62E9E153544BE83.description:
Demonstrates interest
in written forms of
language, such as print
in books or signs on
building

516D77AB7254477C9E9CF2E1578A7B41.description:
Recognizes and
engages with print and
pictures, or braille in their
environment (e.g., points
to words and images;
touches with fingers)

4E44F6F3207843DA89F84712A5555657.description:
Holds books, turns
pages, looks at the
pictures and uses
sounds, signs, or words
to identify actions or
objects in a book or
other written material

370A79436EC2482BB529DD64CF09EEEF.description:
Explores a book by
touching it, patting it,
or putting it in mouth

77307C6E17EB4DB28CBD6CF65C2E9796.description: Paying attention to print as meaningful

E5333C69BDF749D6BFAB696C2CDB1D41.description:
Asks and responds to
questions with accurate
information

C27A54786AEE4F4C9BE4045A5A3D030F.description:
Engages in multiple
back-and-forth
conversations with adults
in ways that can be goal
directed (such as solving
problems)

686CE1207EC143C6B24311B3D2F29478.description:
Begins to match
language to contexts
(e.g., voice volume,
inflection/rise and fall of
voice in speaking, and
parting/greeting rituals)

6428972C86144F37AD2FD24585B56DC4.description:
Continues a
conversation through
several exchanges with
or without adult help

62E5FBFF4C1E4C7F9636558EA9E33C4B.description:
Begins to ask and
respond to questions

9D07A2C624F040079D0BBE887D986836.description:
Uses words, gestures,
signs, and phrases to
converse with others

14C8FF82B5B846628C9F0DBFAF14DF4B.description:
Uses simple verbal
responses and nonverbal
gestures

944D1E2EFEF04860B6BCB336DD2FD984.description:
Responds with facial
expressions, vocalizations,
and/or gestures to engage
in conversation with
others

58849B00B9724E978F329169033FEC17.description:
Begins to follow adult
pointing or gaze to
establish joint attention
(e.g., looks across the
room when adult points
or gazes)

FC460FAEB7C04D179BDF7D5B1C64EB87.description:
Turns, smiles,
and begins to speak
when name is spoken

A827C4EC1F6B4761877CB50714144766.description:
Takes turn in
“conversation” or
vocal play with adults

8188BF5466324DB09A699E3E52F4A11F.description:
Engages in vocal
exchanges by babbling

29F8BC1C258A48529B0E29CFA8E8D676.description:
Reacts to facial
cues and eye contact

D0C919AAB25749C0A72899539BCACC3E.description:
Responds and engages
with an adult or older
peer

1C594F6EA38041E8ADB23D34477D7780.description: Learning and engaging in conversational interactions

5664708C572A4F8BB1D124AE336FE9BC.description:
Retells stories and
events in sequence with
multiple details (e.g.,
retells The Three Bears
noting three chairs, three
beds, etc.)

E7B15DFBEE4E424391916661F7A09B63.description:
Uses age-appropriate
grammar in conversations
and increasingly complex
phrases and sentences
(e.g., uses irregular past
tense verbs such as came,
ran, fell, broke, went,
told, did)

C22010C53CDB4BA8901CC266FDB60D72.description:
Begins to use
prepositions (e.g., in, on)

9E7123E354B343D29E6AC5BA58E8691F.description:
Uses adjectives to
describe people, objects,
or environments

1345AFD1B43C4AAFA07A3612518BD468.description:
Answers questions
from unfamiliar
people including some
open-ended questions

C2C6F0DD7B1E4F0B81804C99D6AC098A.description:
Begins to use complex
sentences and ask simple
questions (e.g., “After the
gingerbread man ran, he
swam on the fox’s back.”;
“What happened to the
gingerbread man?”)

AE35D0D29E614694A0C9610F6BF98250.description:
Begins to use more
diverse types of words,
such as color and
quantity words (all, some,
more, and including
numbers)

BC0E363FF0F34DB0834C3EFE576428E5.description:
Speaks in or signs
short sentences and some
expanded sentences and
is understood by familiar
peers or adults most of
the time

E6F825BB093D4630B1E79052B691498B.description:
Asks short questions
and requests clarifications

88CD484EEA454469B2EDAC20A5B5B307.description:
Begins to combine
words, verbally or
through signing (e.g.,
making requests through
two- and multi-word
use/utterances such as
"eat- or comer-‘nana’/
banana”

47D74EB209854BA48D4008D21158EF04.description:
Uses vocabulary
for familiar items and
events (e.g., hat, ball)

FF15790EDBC14A7DA3A282F1BE444435.description:
Makes simple oneword requests such as
saying or signing “milk’
or “leche” when asking
for a drink)

3E17AE41878A4D568D7170DE768B6A37.description:
Participates and
initiates communication
with family members
or familiar others by
using consistent sounds,
gestures, and some words

A4A5E0A997AF4C91BC8E5D386865107E.description:
Vocalizes or gestures
(e.g., pointing or
using sign language)
to communicate or to
direct adult attention

F30FD15343C0419FA6C30180A64630AC.description:
Imitates actions of
others as nonverbal
communication

854A1B0A9A764AC0B35CB8C7D8832EF3.description:
Cries, coos, babbles
and makes other sounds

7F2E4E9187504E138403D5F284E9DEC8.description:
Uses sound, inflection,
and gestures to
communicate needs,
desires, or emotions

F2FCA060D10D474CA6617659EEF99513.description: Using vocabulary and nonverbal cues to communicate

AC1DFBFEEADA466D9B6F5A80BB2D1BC8.description:
Demonstrates
understanding of
communication that
includes a variety of
complex sentences
related to familiar stories,
learning activities,
and events (e.g., After
Clifford the dog came
home, he played with
Emily Elizabeth.)

DF462C8E3ED14C5C90734F40CCFE85FE.description:
Follows 2-3 step related
directions and some
new directions related
to familiar and daily
routines

A4335E08D964483CBE53A8EFA8A033C4.description:
Understands and
responds to words for
descriptive concepts
(e.g., hard, square)

22A44439EACB4AE09CCE1C3AA2D27DE8.description:
Begins to demonstrate
understanding of
implied messages based
on speaker’s tone and/
or gestures (e.g., finger
on lip and saying
“shhhh” means be quiet)

52C69E68BEC74962B90806661A28F8BE.description:
Answers questions and
adds comments relevant
to the topic

8D456C02F5B7410AAE6FEFF238D94AC5.description:
Understands and
responds to spatial
concepts (e.g., in/out,
under, front, behind)

2DB1711806894EEB851CDC3CE87DB2BB.description:
Understands and
responds to basic
attribute word differences
such as personal (I/me/
you/it) and possessive
(my and mine) pronouns

D1D5E10F3A044BC4A5F189D1C1F97979.description:
Understands and
responds to several
hundred words or more

BE71FFCCE56342CF90C69E2F4EBF7DAA.description:
Follows simple
and short directions
for routine practices

46BB126961824C169D8832C9719D6340.description:
Listens to and attends
to spoken language
and read-aloud texts

E38346288C544B2BBF8F4AB943E4D1AC.description:
Understands and
responds to some
pronouns (mine, you,
me)

46393EFB942247229C194FB01AF4D90A.description:
Begins to recognize
some body parts

C6B05FB735BE471D9E64F6439BF0B589.description:
Identifies familiar
people, animals, and
objects (using gestures,
words, or sounds)

C49BC3E12D53462BA3479A619E74D6AE.description:
Completes a task in
response to a request
(e.g., pick up your
cup, go find your coat)

962FFF5D40C245E5A675732C4B8E394E.description:
Begins to understand
action words (e.g., hop,
jump, press, go, stop)

B2FA6269FC4E4C8496C235F28D1A92AC.description:
Identifies familiar
people, animals, and
objects

7B56751B937C4B84BDF49A2F55CC9595.description:
Uses sounds or
nonverbal cues to
respond to oral reading

B6232F7CFC1545A49AB4DC5436E6F006.description:
Begins to show
understanding of
approximately 50 words

43B0F116FBDB44CA8A59FD8761DCB209.description:
Recognizes common
objects when named
(e.g., cup)

825670CB132B4566ACF4C9FE7C092658.description:
Understands and
responds to simple
commands and
gestures (e.g., shared
eye gaze/contact;
may be influenced by
cultural expectations)

4DBB2DB628B342C6B0FE099169182744.description:
Makes different
sounds to get attention

B534C05781EC4F71A3EE92BB6112080A.description:
Begins to respond
through sounds or
gestures to others’
questions

9E53A2728D28407998E8BA32F12B4101.description:
Follows simple requests
paired with gestures

26453CAA363E4E69BED3C88451A1741A.description:
Responds by looking
when name is called

739C419B56BE4A70A0179600B99B72AD.description:
Directs attention to
sounds or object pointed
at/to

FDBBCD380ADD4C07A8C94DA198DD35F9.description:
Responds to tone
or voice changes

EA1E1883CD5A40A182E1DD9E6F1124ED.description:
Responds to speaker by
turning head or shifting
eye gaze
